The game is grind fest and repetitive for no real good reason. The game has hidden "rules" that the community makes up so that they can have a fair game, so the game itself is unfair from the start. Most players are toxic and risk it all for a cosmetic keychain. There is no real goals that make you feel successful and no real rewards for doing your best in the game. There isn't any game changing or interesting mechanics and no other game modes that you can play. it's overall a boring and unappealing game, I mean unless you like grinding for the sake of grinding.

Dead by Daylight has a pretty steep learning curve, and you'll be confused and frustrated for a long time. However, once you push through it, and learn all the perks and mechanics of the game, you'll only be frustrated! Fun game I'd recommend.

I will be brutally honest, I had to play 1000 hours of this nightmare to write a wrinky-dinky review of this garbage game. 

I don't know what gets me addicted to the game. Could be the fact that there is really no other game like Dead by Doglight. They've stopped listening to their community, and ruined the game by implementing additions that NO ONE asked for (i.e. New animations, MMR. etc.) 

I hate having to go against try-hard survivors as killer when I increase in rank, and I also hate getting tunneled and camped as survivor because the game's new MMR system basically encourages it even more (which is cringe).

Now I say all of this not because I want this game to rot in my garbage can (it may sound like it.) I really do love this game and what it's brought to the table. When I play with my friends, it's really fun, even if the game doesn't go my way. I do have to stress though, that the direction the game is going is not good for the  community. The meta has stayed the same for so long with barely any change, and it gets really stale and boring. I hate having to try hard to play this game, because unfortunately that is what it feels like.

BHVR, please for the love of god fix your game, listen to the community, and stop doing things that we do not want you to do. I have put so much time into this game hoping that it doesn't die in the next five years.
Un buen juego. Divertido tanto solo como con amigos

Its a good 4v1 game if you play with the right people. Some killers AND survivors have a toxic playstyle that can become seriously irritating to put up with, but thats a comment on the players not the game. The game is always updating and giving us new content to play with (new characters, skills, and occasionally maps). Some killers are very pay to win and OP but for the most part survivors have perks that help balance that. If you like teamwork and/or strategy mixed with horror this is the game for you!

Quando comprei o jogo, fui sem muitas esperanças pois não curto muito multiplayer.
Mas descobri que o jogo é bem divertido! Óbvio, você vai encontrar uma galera chata, assim como também vai achar pessoas mais de boa. Por mim, as experiências boas sobressaem as más.

O pior do jogo é o grind. Upar os personagens (desbloquear todos os perks) demora demais. Mas, com o tempo, quanto mais você pega a manha do jogo, mais você descobre que não importa muito o que você leva, dá pra ganhar sem perks e itens fortes, eles só facilitam os seus objetivos. Se você gosta de um perk, aprenda a usá-lo e a tirar proveito dele na sua gameplay - não importa se ele é considerado "fraco" ou "meta".

Recomendo pelo menos a dar uma chance ao game, e tente os dois lados - sobrevivente x assassino - para ver o que você mais gosta de jogar. Não ignore os tutoriais, eles explicam bem o jogo e dão recompensas.
E olhe para todos os lados enquanto faz um gerador...
게임 자체는 참 재밌는데 매칭좀 어떻게 해줬으면... 왜 19시간 뉴비랑 1400시간 4000시간 고인물들이랑 큐가 잡히는지 도저히 이해 불가능임.

This is a game that had potential and was once fun, but nowadays is full of trash tier players who don't know how to play the game. Anyone playing killer should be forced to do 100 survivor matches minimum before they play a single killer match just to know what being tunneled (repeatedly hooked) or camped (when the killer stays by the hook after hooking someone) feels like & how it kills the fun for players.

A few days ago I played against a Doctor who would camp the hooks and when someone came to unhook, they would not attack but wait for the unhook action so they could pick up the unhooking survivor while the hooked one would remain on hook. I mentioned many times that the killer's ability to pick up unhooking survivors should be removed for this very reason, because as it stands, players who play like that give no reason to unhook anyone, therefore letting them die after just 1 hook. But Behaviour (the developer of DBD) could care less---AND THAT IS THE #1 PROBLEM.

They keep releasing new DLC without addressing many bugs (like late killer hits through windows that still down vaulting survivors after they have well cleared the window) and without addressing issues that make for unbalanced, unfair, and toxic gameplay that makes this game not fun. The game crashes pretty frequently for me and THEY PENALIZE ME FOR THEIR POORLY CODED GAME by depipping me and giving me temporary match bans DESPITE FILLING OUT A CRASH REPORT. Same thing happens when I get kicked out of a game because due to a server disconnect, without me ever hitting escape and clicking on "leave match". They have the technology to know whether someone purposely disconnects or not so as to not punish them, but do they care? No. Hell, with some of the toxic new players who play killer, players who do purposely disconnect in many of these cases should not be penalized just because they don't want to reward trash killers with toxic gameplay, but that's another story.

They also have been very nonchalant about DDOS issues that many players were affected by and even used an NFT for Pinhead, which is against Steam's rules, yet this game is not removed by Steam for that offense when other games that committed the same offense were.

A few days ago, I was hanging out by an open exit gate to see if other survivors in the match needed help before exiting because I like to play in an unselfish manner. The killer was Pinhead and the player only had 1 perk, which was not Blood Warden. After the other survivor got out without having been hooked for the duration I was hanging at the exit gate, I turned around and tried to escape but was blocked by a Blood Warden barrier WHEN THE KILLER WAS NOT EVEN RUNNING BLOOD WARDEN!!! I don't know if that killer was cheating/hacking or if the game is bugged out or if Behaviour was just targeting me for trashing them in my error reports and reports for killers playing in an unsportsmanlike manner, but things like that should not happen in a game like this. I've had survivors who popped back up immediately after downing them and watching them do a 360 as they fell down. I had another survivor disappear on me despite me hearing his groans of pain on a Yamaoka map who I dropped so I could break a door to access a hook. It was inside the main building so there was nothing blocking my view. I think he bled out and died (not sure if even other survivors could see or get to heal him).

A problem I ran into when playing killer is these new boon totems that can be infinitely reblessed after the killer snuffs them out each time. It ruins the game for killers so that if a killer wastes their time snuffing out a boon totem, it will be for nothing if the survivor or another one with a boon perk re-blesses it. It's very unbalanced because if boon perks were to be done properly, they should've been done with a token system where there is a maximum of say 5 tokens (where each time a totem is blessed it would deplete a token) or a system where each of the 5 totems in a given match on its map could only be blessed once, which would force survivors to find all the totems instead of blessing the same 1-2 totems over & over again. The new boon perk that allows 100% recovery will only exacerbate this problem more and will encourage more tunneling, camping, and the running of the No One Escapes Death (NOED) perk, which is also a trash and toxic perk. Does Behaviour care? Nope. All they did was make a new killer perk that allows killers to rebuild cleansed totems, which doesn't address this issue whatsoever.

One last thing I wanted to mention is how they have poorly-made challenges that force killers trying to get them to play in toxic ways. An example of this is basement challenges, where the killer has to sacrifice a certain # of survivors on basement hooks and they encourage killers to camp the basement, which is one of the most toxic ways to play DBD. There are also poor achievements such as Michael Myers Evil Incarnate achievement that requires the killer to mori all 4 survivors. I got the achievement, but hated the way I played to get it because mori's are just a disgusting way to play, especially the instant Myers mori using his add-ons where you can kill someone who hasn't even been hooked. What's worse is, it took several tries to get it, so it ended up forcing me to play that disgusting way in all those matches until I finally got it. And even in my quest to get that achievement, I ran into bugs, like a match in one of my early attempts where I mori'd 3 of the 4 survivors, closed the hatch, and my game crashed while patrolling the short distance between the 2 exit gates. There was another attempt where I mori'd 3 of the 4 survivors and there was a Bill who the game would just not let me mori. I could only stab him throughout that match, even when I downed him again later on and went for the ground mori. You have a crappy achievement that forces player to play in ways they'd rather not and glitches along the way that prolong that disgusting style of play that the game's poor coding caused.

So if you want to throw your hard-earned money out the door and later regret buying it and have a feeling of betrayal, buy this game. Or else stay clear. I have many friends who used to play this game with me in groups of 4 when we did surviving with friends (SWF) sessions and almost all of them have quit playing because they got fed up with the BS. This game really tends to bring the worst out of many players.

Peli, jossa pärjääminen vaatii pelaajalta totuttelua, pitkää pinnaa ja liudan erilaisten pelitaktiikoiden treenaamista. Alussa en nauttinut tästä pelistä YHTÄÄN, ja se vaikutti vähintäänkin erittäin monimutkaiselta, mutta kun vain puski alkukankeuden läpi, niin yhtäkkiä olinkin jo koukussa. Kirjaimellisesti.

Pelin DLC-painotteisuus on häirinnyt minua yllättävän vähän, sillä uusia hahmoja saa ostettua myös ilmaiseksi (vaikka siinä meneekin pitkään), eikä minua haittaa heittää kymppiä lisää peliin aina silloin tällöin. Sen sijaan yllättävän ärsyttävänä olen kokenut suurikokoiset päivitykset, jotka todellakin vievät tilaa. 

Itse pelaaminen on usein turhauttavaa, mutta sitten kun muutaman kerran todella onnistuu pakenemaan viime hetkellä, osumaan täydellisesti jokaisen skill checkin, niittaamaan koko selviytyjäporukan kellariin tai luuppaamaan killeriä pidemmän aikaa, kaikki se vaiva on sen arvoista. Tietysti aina silloin tällöin palaa pinna camppaaviin tappajiin, itsekkäisiin tiimikavereihin ja omaan surkeuteen, jolloin on pakko ottaa peliin vähän etäisyyttä, mutta ainakin toistaiseksi olen aina halunnut palata takaisin pelin pariin viimeistään seuraavana päivänä. Onhan tätä nyt tullut parin kuukauden aikana tahkottua jo se 200+ tuntia, joka ainakin allekirjoittaneelle on ihan massiivinen määrä. Peli toimii mielestäni niin yksin kuin kavereidenkin kanssa pelattuna.

TLDR; v*tun ärsyttävä p*ska peli, mutta pakkohan sitä nyt taas on pari roundia vetää.

I wish I could be more positive about the state of the game, but the truth of the matter is the devs are very content to ignore the state of the game. There is a very clear lack of respect for the game and it's community from the devs. This game only survives because of it's massive amount  of IP's it has in-game, and that it has virtually no competition in it's genre. Most of us are still here because of sunk cost fallacy, and no other game can scratch this game's itch. It's just sad to see that they have something really special with this, and they constantly, without fail, keep disappointing us.

[code] Dead by Daylight é um jogo de terror de sobrevivência de  multijogador desenvolvido pela Behaviour Interactive.[/code]

Existem duas categorias,

[list]
    [*]Suvivor
    [*] Killer
[/list]

[i]No modo suvivor ou sobrevivente alem de você pode jogar sozinho ou com seus amigos até 4 jogadores tem o objetivo de sobreviver diante de um assassino desconhecido. Sobreviventes podem usar itens, habilidades desbloqueadas e objetos do ambiente para enganar o assassino e escapar do seu território.  O nosso objetivo como sobrevivente é consertar 5 geradores para abrir os portões de saída, nesse meio tempo terá um assassino para nos impedir disso. Podemos usar recursos tais como [/i]
[table]
    [tr]
        [th]Itens[/th]
        [th]Descrição[/th]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Kit medico[/td]
        [td]Serve para curar tanto você como seus amigos mais rapido[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Caixa de Ferramenta[/td]
        [td]Conserta mais rápido os geradores e serve para destruir ganchos por um certo período[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Lanternas e bombinha[/td]
        [td]Ajudam a atordoar o assassino, no caso deixa los cegos por um intervalo de tempo[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Mapas e Chave[/td]
        [td]Mapa serve para ver os objetos do território e a chave para abrir a escotilha caso o Killer a feche.[/td]
    [/tr]
[/table]

[i] Já os assassinos ou killers no caso esse modo você vai com um assassino que engloba vários assassinos de series e filmes famosos e tem os que foram criados do próprio jogo para que você detenha os sobreviventes de escapar, temos que colocar os sobreviventes em ganchos espalhados pelo mapa, e cada assassino pode realizar a morte com as mãos, como se fosse um especial, mata um sobrevivente de um jeito único. Cada Assassino tem suas próprias habilidades e vantagens a seu favor cabe ao jogador da melhor estrategia conseguir derrotar todos os sobreviventes. [/i]

[quote=Narberal] Dead by Daylight é um jogo muito bom, é divertido, passa raiva, tira estresse, poem estresse, você pode sobreviver ou ser o caçador, pode se divertir com os amigos ou sozinho, alem disso tem o modo treinamento para você aprender cada modo e um modo alternativo que você pode ir com seu amigo de killer para jogarem juntos. [/quote]

[h1] Super Recomendo a compra, está em um preço acessível, mas em eventos ele diminui o preço, tem as DLC de personagens licenciados e o do próprio jogo. Recomendo comprar as DLC por que o jogo vem com uma quantidade X de sobreviventes e assassinos. Para os amantes de conquistas steam, terá que ter todas as DLC para obter todas as conquistas, mesmo assim em eventos diminuem em 50% o valor de tudo, e compensa muito. [/h1]

Very fun game with or without friends. But of course with me friends is preferred. The game can be quite frustrating and piss me off but I always end up going back to it with my friends. The feeling of outplaying the killer is so excellent and absolutely destroying the survivors as a wide variety of different killers is worth the pain sometimes. Of course not being able to play the killers you want without buying them sucks but I enjoy it enough that I have actually put real cash into this game and I never do that with games. So overall I would recommenced this game especially if you have friends that are willing to get the game as well.

If you want a game that will support you, make you smile, and something to enjoy with friends, go play animal crossing, because this game will make you want to rip off your toenails one by one in such a violent rage that is only stoppable by some time in a nice jacket and a softly padded room. Looking to make friends in this game? Absolutely not. This game is full of only the most vile creatures among the human race, so overflowing with toxicity that they'll make you want to commit a war crime. And if you think you're actually doing well for once, whether as killer or survivor, think again, because the opposing team will undoubtedly throw a tantrum and disconnect from the game. They have a nice plague doctor outfit for Doctor though and my spouse thinks I excuberate Dwight Fairfield energy, so I guess 10/10
